summary: This is the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2018 Trust Agreement, dated May 8, 2018, establishing a revocable trust with Epstein as Grantor and three initial Trustees. The document outlines extensive bequests to numerous individuals upon Epstein's death, including large cash sums, annuities, and real property transfers, and details the administration and powers of the Trustees.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The creator and primary beneficiary of the trust during his lifetime, outlining extensive posthumous bequests to associates and others.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Named as an initial Trustee of the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2018 Trust and is designated to receive a $20 million bequest and have his debts to Epstein's entities forgiven.

persons.name: Richard D. Kahn
persons.context: Named as an initial Trustee of the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2018 Trust and is designated to receive a $20 million bequest and have his debts to Epstein's entities forgiven.

persons.name: Katheryn H. Ruemmler
persons.context: Named as an initial Trustee of the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2018 Trust.

persons.name: Karyna Shuliak
persons.context: Designated to receive $20 million, a $20 million annuity, and ownership of Epstein's Zorro Ranch in New Mexico and his Palm Beach, Florida property.

persons.name: Lesley Katherine Groff
persons.context: Designated to receive a $2 million bequest and have any loans from Epstein forgiven.

persons.name: Luciano A. Fontanilla, Jr.
persons.context: Designated to receive a $2 million annuity and full ownership of the property at 18 Teneyck Avenue, Valley Stream, New York, with any loans from Epstein forgiven.

persons.name: Rosalyn V. Fontanilla
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to the contingent beneficiaries of an annuity for Luciano A. Fontanilla, Jr.

persons.name: Ann Rodriquez
persons.context: Designated to receive a $500,000 bequest and have her debts to Epstein's entities forgiven.

persons.name: Bella Klein
persons.context: Designated to receive a $250,000 bequest and have her debts to Epstein's entities forgiven.

persons.name: Paul Barrett
persons.context: Designated to have all his financial obligations to Epstein or Epstein's entities forgiven upon Epstein's death.

persons.name: Lawrence Paul Visoski, Jr.
persons.context: Designated to have all his financial obligations to Epstein or Epstein's entities forgiven upon Epstein's death.

persons.name: Eileen Visoski
persons.context: Mentioned as the spouse of Lawrence Paul Visoski, Jr. in the context of debt forgiveness.

persons.name: Michelle Fern Saipher
persons.context: Mentioned as the spouse of Darren K. Indyke in the context of debt forgiveness.

persons.name: Lisa Kahn
persons.context: Mentioned as the spouse of Richard D. Kahn in the context of debt forgiveness.

persons.name: Barnaby Marsh
persons.context: Named as the first person to be appointed to fill any vacancy among the three primary Trustees of the main trust.

persons.name: Habibe Avdiu
persons.context: Notary public who witnessed the signing of the trust agreement by Epstein and the Trustees.

connections.description: Epstein names Indyke as a Trustee and primary beneficiary, and the trust outlines mechanisms to forgive Indyke's debts to Epstein's companies.
Epstein names Kahn as a Trustee and primary beneficiary, and the trust outlines mechanisms to forgive Kahn's debts to Epstein's companies.
Epstein names Ruemmler as a Trustee of his 2018 trust.
Epstein designates Shuliak to receive the most substantial bequests, including tens of millions of dollars and key real estate properties (Zorro Ranch, Palm Beach home).
Both serve as initial Trustees of the Epstein 2018 Trust and are jointly given specific administrative roles for a sub-trust for Karyna Shuliak.
Epstein leaves Groff a $2 million bequest and forgives any loans she owes, indicating a close professional or personal relationship.
Epstein leaves Fontanilla significant assets including a property and an annuity, and forgives his loans.

events.title: Execution of Epstein 2018 Trust
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signs the 'Jeffrey E. Epstein 2018 Trust' agreement, establishing a complex revocable trust with three initial trustees.

events.title: Epstein's Death (Contingent Event)
events.description: The entire trust document is structured around the contingent event of Epstein's death, triggering the payment of debts, taxes, and the distribution of all bequests and assets to the named beneficiaries.

locations: 18 Teneyck Avenue, Valley Stream, New York
49 Zorro Ranch Road, Stanley, New Mexico
358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, Florida
United States Virgin Islands (governing law and situs of trust)
New York, New York (location of signing)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein created a revocable trust in May 2018, just over a year before his death, which gave him total control over the assets during his life but laid out a detailed plan for distribution afterward.
The trust designates massive financial bequests, including $20 million plus a $20 million annuity to Karyna Shuliak, and $20 million each to trustees Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn.
Key real estate assets like Zorro Ranch in New Mexico and the Palm Beach, Florida property are bequeathed to Karyna Shuliak.
The trust includes provisions to forgive substantial debts owed to Epstein or his companies by close associates like Indyke, Kahn, Lesley Groff, and others.
The document reveals a network of Epstein-owned entities used to hold assets, including Southern Financial LLC, FT Real Estate Inc., Cypress Inc., Laurel Inc., and Lyn & Jojo LLC.
